DataElement.preferredName: ICANS Increased Intracranial Pressure Or Cerebral Edema Attribution Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome (ICANS) description for the participant's elevated ICP/cerebral edema (not attributable to any other cause).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome Increased Intracranial Pressure Or Cerebral Edema Attribution
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: _Neurotoxicity associated with immune effector cell therapy. It may be characterized by aphasia, altered level of consciousness, motor weakness, seizures, and cerebral edema:Pressure within the craniospinal compartment is increased._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid in the brain._To assign to a cause or source.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Neurotoxicity associated with immune effector cell therapy. It may be characterized by aphasia, altered level of consciousness, motor weakness, seizures, and cerebral edema.

Concepts.definition: Neurotoxicity associated with immune effector cell therapy. It may be characterized by aphasia, altered level of consciousness, motor weakness, seizures, and cerebral edema.

PermissibleValues.value: Diffuse cerebral edema on neuroimaging; decerebrate or decorticate posturing; or cranial nerve VI palsy; or papilledema; or Cushingâ€™s triad

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Diffuse Cerebral Edema Decerebrate Posture Decorticate Posture Cranial Nerve VI Palsy Papilledema Cushing Triad
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Widely spread; not localized or confined._Swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid in the brain._A posture characterized body rigidity and by extension of the neck, arms, and legs. It may indicate brain stem damage and may suggest herniation of the brain._A posture characterized by body rigidity, flexion of the arms over the chest, clenched fists,  and extension of the legs. It may indicate cerebral damage._Paralysis of the abducens nerve._Swelling around the optic disc, usually due to increased intracranial pressure or pressure on the optic nerve by a tumor._A group of signs that often occurs in response to increased intracranial pressure: hypertension, bradycardia, and irregular breathing.

Concepts.definition: Widely spread; not localized or confined.
Swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid in the brain.
A posture characterized body rigidity and by extension of the neck, arms, and legs. It may indicate brain stem damage and may suggest herniation of the brain.
A posture characterized by body rigidity, flexion of the arms over the chest, clenched fists,  and extension of the legs. It may indicate cerebral damage.
Swelling around the optic disc, usually due to increased intracranial pressure or pressure on the optic nerve by a tumor.
A group of signs that often occurs in response to increased intracranial pressure: hypertension, bradycardia, and irregular breathing.
